data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take right step 9 steps straight ahead. Take left step 9 steps left. Take forward step 10 steps forward. Take backward step 10 steps backward. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around means changing direction opposite to where you came from. The starting point would be in the direction you were walking from. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 4 steps to get to the starting point. Turn around and take 10 steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you are returning to the starting point after making a first step, you have to make another first step. The answer: Yes.

Turn around and you are in the end point which is the starting point. Turning left is one more of those steps than turning around. So, the answer is No.
